propertyDisputes.title: Property Disputes
propertyDisputes.description: Property disputes arise when ownership, possession, or boundary rights are unclear or challenged. This service helps you confirm legal ownership, resolve conflicts, and act against illegal possession or incorrect documentation.

cards.title: Land Ownership & Possession Disputes
cards.subtitle: Conflicts where more than one person claims the same property.

cards.title: Family Partition Issues
cards.subtitle: Disputes over dividing family or ancestral property.

cards.title: Boundary & Measurement Conflicts
cards.subtitle: Problems regarding land size or boundary markings.

cards.title: Illegal Possession / Encroachment
cards.subtitle: When someone occupies property without permission.

cards.title: Builder Delay or Fraud
cards.subtitle: Issues involving delayed possession or false commitments.

cards.title: Will / Inheritance Disputes
cards.subtitle: Confusion over rightful heirs or property distribution.

cards.title: Registration, Transfer & Title Problems
cards.subtitle: Errors or mismatches in property documents.

faqs.question: How do I know if I legally own the property?
faqs.answer: By checking your sale deed, land records, and past ownership history — we verify all of it for you.

faqs.question: Can a property dispute be solved without going to court?
faqs.answer: Yes, many cases are resolved through notices, negotiation, or family settlements.

faqs.question: How long does a property case usually take?
faqs.answer: It depends on complexity, but we guide you toward the fastest possible route.

faqs.question: What if someone illegally occupies my property?
faqs.answer: You can take legal action for eviction, removal, and recovery of possession.

familyMatters.title: Family Matters
familyMatters.description: Family matters address legal issues within relationships such as separation, financial support, domestic disputes, and child-related decisions.

cards.title: Divorce Consultation
cards.subtitle: Legal steps and guidance for separating couples.

cards.title: Maintenance & Alimony
cards.subtitle: Financial support claims after separation.

cards.title: Domestic Violence Protection
cards.subtitle: Help for individuals facing abuse or threats.

cards.title: Child Custody & Guardianship
cards.subtitle: Decisions about child care after separation.

cards.title: Family Settlements

cards.title: Dowry Harassment Matters
cards.subtitle: Cases involving dowry demands or false allegations.

cards.title: Marriage Documentation / Registration
cards.subtitle: Assistance with legal paperwork.

faqs.question: Do I need a lawyer to file for divorce?
faqs.answer: Not always, but legal guidance ensures your rights are protected regarding property, maintenance, and custody.

faqs.question: How is child custody decided?
faqs.answer: Based on the child’s welfare, living conditions, and parental stability.

faqs.question: Can maintenance be claimed even if I'm not divorced?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can claim support during separation.

faqs.question: Are family matters kept confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes, complete privacy is maintained.

bail.title: Bail & Anticipatory Bail
bail.description: Bail services help individuals prevent arrest or secure release quickly. This service ensures timely filing of bail applications and guides you through urgent criminal procedures.

cards.title: Anticipatory Bail
cards.subtitle: Protection when you fear arrest.

cards.title: Regular Bail
cards.subtitle: Assistance for securing release from custody.

cards.title: Bail Documentation
cards.subtitle: Preparation of required papers and grounds.

cards.title: Court Representation
cards.subtitle: Support during bail hearings.

cards.title: Urgent Legal Assistance
cards.subtitle: Immediate help in time-sensitive situations.

faqs.question: When should I apply for anticipatory bail?
faqs.answer: When you believe someone may file a complaint or FIR against you.

faqs.question: How fast can bail be arranged?
faqs.answer: Often within the same day, depending on court timing.

faqs.question: Will getting bail mean I'm proven guilty?
faqs.answer: No — bail only ensures you remain free during the investigation.

cheatingHarassment.title: Cheating, Threats & Harassment Cases
cheatingHarassment.description: These matters involve complaints or allegations of cheating, threats, abuse, or harassment. This service helps you file strong complaints or defend against false accusations.

cards.title: Cheating / Fraud Cases
cards.subtitle: Disputes involving money, trust, or breach of promise.

cards.title: Criminal Intimidation / Threats
cards.subtitle: Complaints related to verbal or written threats.

cards.title: Harassment Cases
cards.subtitle: Situations involving repeated disturbance or abuse.

cards.title: False Allegation Defence
cards.subtitle: Support if someone files a misleading complaint.

cards.title: Settlement & Mediation
cards.subtitle: When issues can be resolved peacefully.

faqs.question: Should I file an FIR or a police complaint first?
faqs.answer: We help you decide based on urgency and the strength of your case.

faqs.question: What if the allegations against me are false?
faqs.answer: You can defend yourself legally with evidence and proper replies.

faqs.question: Can harassment cases be resolved without going to court?
faqs.answer: Sometimes yes, if both parties agree.

documentsLicensing.title: Government Document & Licensing Issues
documentsLicensing.description: Administrative matters arise when government procedures, documents, or licenses face delays or complications. This service helps you correct, update, or obtain necessary approvals smoothly.

cards.title: Licensing & Permit Issues
cards.subtitle: Help with obtaining or renewing official licenses.

cards.title: Document Correction Requests
cards.subtitle: Fixing errors in government-issued documents.

cards.title: Application Support
cards.subtitle: Guidance for submissions and required paperwork.

cards.title: Status Follow-up
cards.subtitle: Assistance with delayed or pending applications.

cards.title: Compliance Queries
cards.subtitle: Clarification of rules and requirements.

faqs.question: How do I correct errors in government documents?
faqs.answer: Most corrections need applications and supporting proofs — we guide and prepare everything.

faqs.question: Why is my document or license delayed?
faqs.answer: Usually due to missing documents or pending verification.

faqs.question: Can you speed up a stuck application?
faqs.answer: We help follow up with departments and fix issues blocking the process.

challengeOrders.title: Challenges Against Government Orders
challengeOrders.description: This service helps individuals and businesses challenge unfair, incorrect, or excessive government orders, notices, or penalties through proper legal channels.

cards.title: Challenging Penalties
cards.subtitle: When unfair fines or actions are issued.

cards.title: Replying to Government Notices
cards.subtitle: Proper responses to avoid escalation.

cards.title: Appeals Against Decisions
cards.subtitle: Legal steps to overturn incorrect orders.

cards.title: Compliance Clarification
cards.subtitle: Support in understanding requirements.

cards.title: Representation Before Authorities
cards.subtitle: Assistance in hearings or meetings.

faqs.question: Can I challenge any government notice?
faqs.answer: Yes, if it is unfair, incorrect, or issued without proper grounds.

faqs.question: What if I miss the deadline to reply?
faqs.answer: It can cause penalties — always respond quickly; we prepare replies on time.

faqs.question: Do I need to go to court for every challenge?
faqs.answer: Not always; some issues get resolved by filing objections or appeals.

publicMatters.title: Public Interest Related Matters
publicMatters.description: Public law matters involve issues affecting communities, public rights, or social welfare. This service helps identify suitable legal remedies for concerns impacting the broader public.

cards.title: Public Safety Concerns
cards.subtitle: Matters affecting large groups or communities.

cards.title: Local Governance Issues
cards.subtitle: Disputes involving public services or civic authorities.

cards.title: Policy-Related Complaints
cards.subtitle: When administrative decisions harm public interest.

cards.title: Public Welfare Matters
cards.subtitle: Issues related to environment, health, or misuse of resources.

cards.title: Guidance on PIL Feasibility
cards.subtitle: Help understanding if a matter qualifies for PIL.

faqs.question: How do I know if my issue qualifies as public interest?
faqs.answer: If it affects community rights or public welfare, it may qualify.

faqs.question: Is filing a PIL expensive or complicated?
faqs.answer: It depends — we guide you on feasibility before taking any step.

faqs.question: Can an individual file a public interest matter?
faqs.answer: Yes, if the issue affects society.

rightsViolation.title: Rights Violation Complaints
rightsViolation.description: This service addresses situations where authorities or individuals violate someone’s rights, dignity, or lawful freedoms.

cards.title: Police Misconduct Complaints
cards.subtitle: When officers misuse power.

cards.title: Authority Misbehaviour
cards.subtitle: Cases involving officials acting illegally.

cards.title: Access to Services Issues
cards.subtitle: When basic public rights are denied.

cards.title: Unfair Treatment Cases
cards.subtitle: Actions violating individual dignity.

cards.title: Support in Filing Complaints
cards.subtitle: Help with applications, evidence, and process.

faqs.question: What should I do if a police officer misuses their power?
faqs.answer: You can file a complaint with proper evidence; we help prepare it.

faqs.question: Are rights violation complaints taken seriously?
faqs.answer: Yes, especially when supported by documents or witnesses.

faqs.question: Can I remain anonymous while complaining?
faqs.answer: Depends on the department and nature of complaint.

fundamentalRights.title: Fundamental Rights Protection
fundamentalRights.description: This service focuses on safeguarding your rights under the Constitution, especially when authorities act unfairly or restrict your lawful freedoms.

cards.title: Equality & Non-Discrimination Issues
cards.subtitle: Cases involving unfair treatment.

cards.title: Right to Liberty Matters
cards.subtitle: Concerns related to personal freedom.

cards.title: Privacy Violations
cards.subtitle: Interference with personal information.

cards.title: Freedom of Movement / Expression Issues
cards.subtitle: Restrictions without lawful grounds.

cards.title: Guidance on Constitutional Remedies
cards.subtitle: Help choosing the correct legal route.

faqs.question: How do I know if my fundamental right is violated?
faqs.answer: If an authority restricts your liberty, privacy, equality, or freedom without reason.

faqs.question: Do all rights violations need a writ?
faqs.answer: Not always — some issues resolve with complaints first.

writPetitions.title: Writ Petitions
writPetitions.description: Writ petitions are used to challenge illegal actions, prevent misuse of power, or demand government authorities to act lawfully.

cards.title: Habeas Corpus
cards.subtitle: When someone is illegally detained.

cards.title: Mandamus
cards.subtitle: When authorities refuse their duty.

cards.title: Certiorari
cards.subtitle: To cancel unlawful orders.

cards.title: Prohibition
cards.subtitle: Stop lower bodies from exceeding powers.

cards.title: Quo Warranto
cards.subtitle: Question someone's right to hold office.

faqs.question: Do I need to go directly to the High Court for a writ?
faqs.answer: Yes, writs are filed in High Court or Supreme Court only.

faqs.question: How long does a writ petition take?
faqs.answer: Depends on urgency; some are heard immediately.

faqs.question: Which writ should I file?
faqs.answer: We suggest the correct one based on your situation.

landVerification.title: Land Ownership & Title Verification
landVerification.description: This service verifies whether a land or property is legally safe to buy, sell, or transfer.

cards.title: Document Verification
cards.subtitle: Checking sale deeds, RTC, and other papers.

cards.title: Title Check
cards.subtitle: Ensuring clear and undisputed ownership.

cards.title: Past Record Examination
cards.subtitle: Identifying prior disputes/issues.

cards.title: Encumbrance Check
cards.subtitle: Confirming no loans or liabilities.

cards.title: Legal Advisory Before Purchase
cards.subtitle: Avoid risky properties.

faqs.question: Why should I verify a property before buying it?
faqs.answer: To avoid fraud, hidden disputes, or unclear ownership.

faqs.question: How long does title verification take?
faqs.answer: Usually 1–3 days depending on records.

faqs.question: Is online property information enough?
faqs.answer: No — many critical details are only found in physical records.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for property registration?
faqs.answer: Sale deed, ID proofs, photographs, and payment details.

faqs.question: Can I register property in someone else's name?
faqs.answer: Yes, with proper documentation.

faqs.question: What happens if the registration is delayed?
faqs.answer: Stamp duty may increase and the transfer becomes legally incomplete.
